description: Excavation to provide part  basement level;  two storey side extension; conversion of roof area into habitable space including a rear dormer roof extension and installation of four roof lights to front roof slope; to faciliate the creation of three self-contained flats
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the drawing titles: 1958/12 Rev. E; 1958/13 Rev. F; 1958/14 Rev. F; 1958/15 Rev. C; 1958/16 Rev. D; 1958/17 Rev. D; 1958/18 Rev. F; 1958/19 Rev. E; 1958/20 Rev. A; 1958/22 Rev. A; and 1958/23.

REASON: For avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing dwellinghouse, and shall be consistent with those as listed within the submitted application form and the drawings / plans as listed in Condition 2.

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and surrounding area in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016); 1.1 and 1.2 of the Local Development Framework (Core) Strategy (2012); and 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013). | Development shall not commence (including demolition and site clearance) until a Construction Management Plan has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The Construction Management Plan to be submitted shall include the following information:
a)	on-site construction worker parking;
b)	anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles entering/exiting the site;
c)	delivery times and booking system (staggered to avoid morning and afternoon school run peak periods);
d)	site access for construction traffic and contractor staff parking and associated signage;
e)	consolidated or re-timed trips;
f)	site security;
g)	secure, off-street loading and drop-off facilities;
h)	vehicle manoeuvring and turning, including swept path diagrams to demonstrate how vehicles will access the site and be able to turn into and emerge from the site in forward gear;
i)	details as to the locations for the storage of building materials and construction debris and contractors' offices;

j)	procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents including the name, telephone number and address of a responsible person to whom enquiries / complaints should be directed. These contact details shall also be displayed at regular intervals around the site compound;
k)	using TfL's Freight Operator Recognition Scheme (FORS) or similar; and

l)	details of control measures for dust, noise, vibration, lighting, delivery locations, restriction of hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary to 08:00-18:00hrs Mondays to Fridays and 08:00-13:00 hrs on Saturdays, and the advance notification to neighbours and other interested parties of proposed works.
The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the approved Construction Management Plan for the duration of the works.

REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with policies 6.3 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016); and 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | A minimum of three (3) 240 litre bins dedicated to recycling and three (3) 240 litre bins dedicated to refuse shall be provided as shown in the Approved Plans listed in Condition 2 and in accordance with adopted standards of the local planning authority. Such provision shall be brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.

REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies 5.1 of the London Plan (2016); 1.1 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); and 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | A minimum of nine (9) cycle parking spaces shall be provided as shown in the Approved Plans listed in Condition 2 and in accordance with adopted standards of the London Plan (2016). Such provision shall be brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.

REASON: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2016). | Enhanced sound insulation for the approved residential building shall be installed to achieve an enhanced sound insulation value DnT,w [and L'nT,w] of at least 5dB above the Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/ uses in adjoining dwellings, namely bathroom above bedroom of separate lower ground floor dwelling. The enhanced sound insulation measures shall be installed and fully completed prior to the first use and / or first occupation of the units and maintained thereafter.

REASON: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policies 7.15 of the London Plan (2016); 1.1(j) of Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and the interim SPG 10: Noise and Vibration. | Prior to commencement of the development, a noise assessment shall be submitted to the Council for approval of external noise levels from transport and industrial/commercial/community sources and details of the sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications and of acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building) to achieve internal room and external amenity noise standards in accordance with the criteria of BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

REASON: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise from transport noise sources in accordance with policies 7.15 of the London Plan (2016); 1.1(j) of Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and the interim SPG 10: Noise and Vibration. | Any side-facing windows installed on an upper-floor must be obscured-glazed and non-opening unless the parts of the window which can be opened are more than 1.7m above the floor of the room in which the window is installed.
REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with policies 7.6 of the London Plan (2016); and 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
